result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marvell Clayton

records.addlTxt:
CLERK ERROR: 10/15/22 BAIL AMOUNT NOT PREVIOUSLY ENTERED.

CORRECTION: Cash bond of $100.00 set on 10/15/22.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Metro Market. Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Marvell Clayton appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz appeared by video for Marvell Clayton.  Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
